Term_1.name: Austenite decomposition
Term_1.description: Process of austenite breakdown into ferrite, pearlite, bainite, or martensite in steels [[1]]

Term_2.name: CALPHAD method
Term_2.description: Thermodynamic modeling approach for phase equilibrium calculations [[5]]

Term_3.name: Martensitic transformation
Term_3.description: Diffusionless phase transition forming martensite in steels [[18]]

Material_1.name: Alloyed steels
Material_1.description: Steels with Mn, Cr, Ni, Mo, and Cu additions studied in the article [[1]]

Material_2.name: Austenite
Material_2.description: High-temperature phase in steels undergoing decomposition [[1]]

Material_3.name: Ferrite
Material_3.description: Body-centered cubic iron phase formed during cooling [[1]]

Material_4.name: Pearlite
Material_4.description: Lamellar structure of ferrite and cementite [[9]]

Material_5.name: Bainite
Material_5.description: Acicular microstructure formed via shear transformation [[17]]

Material_6.name: Martensite
Material_6.description: Hard phase formed via diffusionless transformation [[20]]

Technology_1.name: Mathematical modeling
Technology_1.description: Computational approach to simulate phase transformations [[1]]

Process_1.name: Ferrite transformation
Process_1.description: Diffusion-controlled formation of ferrite from austenite [[2]]

Process_2.name: Pearlite transformation
Process_2.description: Cooperative growth of ferrite and cementite lamellae [[9]]

Process_3.name: Bainite transformation
Process_3.description: Shear-based formation of acicular ferrite and carbides [[17]]

Process_4.name: Martensitic transformation
Process_4.description: Athermal formation of martensite below Mₛ temperature [[20]]

Phenomenon_2.name: Phase equilibrium
Phenomenon_2.description: Thermodynamic state with minimal Gibbs energy [[5]]

Equipment_1.name: Computer program
Equipment_1.description: C++ software implementing the mathematical model [[4]]

Topic_1.name: Materials Science

Article_1.name: Mathematical Modelling of Kinetics of Decomposition of the Supercooled Austenite in Alloyed Steels
